description: Morgan & Morgan, PA a Claimants litigation firm with over 25 years of experience, more than 250 lawyers, and a support staff of nearly 1,500 employees, is seeking an energetic Florida-licensed attorney to represent ERISA LTD claimants out of our Orlando, FL Office.  Being part of the Morgan & Morgan team is more than a job; each day provides you with the opportunity to assist in protecting consumers against a powerful insurance industry that has laws stacked in its favor.  Requirements  Ideal candidate will have experience in Federal Court.  Pay commensurate with experience. Base pay with bonus opportunities.  Candidates must be results oriented, capable of handling a large case volume and be able to interact effectively with clients on a regular basis, willing to travel throughout Florida as needed. Must have extensive deposition and trial experience, excellent writing skills and the ability to work in harmony with other attorneys, management, and staff.

Description:  Lone Tree - CO, BRCOQ4, 9899 Schwab Way, 80124-5377  Axle J Marcoline  20180412-2551  We believe that , when done right, investing liberates people to create their own destiny.  We are driven  by our purpose to champion every clients goals with passion and integrity.  We respect  and appreciate the diversity of our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve.  We challenge  conventions strategically to create value for our clients, our firm and the world. We live and bring to life the concept of own your tomorrow every day.  We champion  our employee strengths, guide their development, and invest in their long-term success.  We hire  optimistic, results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people with the desire to help our clients and one another succeed.    As a company, we were established by Chuck over 40 years ago to champion Main Street over Wall Street, and to help Americans transform themselves from earners to owners. Through advocacy and innovation, we work to make investing more affordable, accessible and understandable for all. As we enter our fifth decade, we are looking for talented, innovative and driven people who believe they can help themselves, and our clients, create a better future.    Our Opportunity:    Charles Schwab Investment Management (CSIM) is the asset management arm of the Charles Schwab Corporation, and has over $320 billion under management in mutual funds and ETFs. Products managed include a wide variety of active and indexed equity, fixed income, and asset allocation strategies, as well as money markets funds. CSIM uses a consistent and disciplined approach to investing across all our products and seeks to develop innovative new products to meet the core investing needs of our clients.    Charles Schwab Investment Management (CSIM) seeks to recruit an experienced investment professional to serve as Associate Portfolio Manager with day-to-day responsibility for managing index needs for the Passive Strategy equity funds, which include Schwab Equity ETFs and Index Mutual Funds; as well as supporting portfolio managers in the daily investment processes.      What youll do:   Support and work closely with Passive Equity Portfolio Managers.   Support the equity trading and ETF basket processes by working closely with various counterparties including trading, trade operations, fund accounting, custodians and technology.   Responsible for research, analysis and projection of index changes and corporate actions.   Identify and analyze value add trades arising from index and corporate action activity.   Work with index vendors to manage index related information and ensure integrity of index data in portfolio management tools.   To learn more about the culture at Schwab, click here to meet our people.    What you have:   Bachelors degree required. Degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Accounting or related field highly preferred. CFA or progress toward CFA charter desirable.   2+ years of relevant experience in roles requiring strong quantitative technical and analytical skills.   Ability to process, manage, and analyze large amounts of data via Microsoft Excel, VBA, and SQL databases.   Experience with investment tools and systems such as Bloomberg, Factset, Charles River, and other risk management products.   Experience in Asset management or capital markets. Working experience and knowledge of index methodology desirable.   Strong attention to detail and communication skills.   This is a summary only and duties and responsibilities may be changed from time to time, or over time      What youll get:   Comprehensive Compensation and Benefits package.   Financial Health: 401k Match, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Employee Discounts, Personalized advice, Brokerage discounts.   Work/Life Balance: Paid Parental Leave, New Mothers returning to work Program, Tuition Reimbursement Programs, Time off to volunteer, Employee Matching Gifts Program.   Everyday Wellness: Health and Lifestyle Wellness Rewards, Onsite Fitness Classes, Healthy Food Choices, Wellness Champions.   Inclusion: Employee Resource Groups, Commitment to diversity, Strategic partnerships.   Not just a job, but a career, with an opportunity to do the best work of your life.   Learn more about Life@Schwab.    Charles Schwab & Co., Inc. is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to diversifying its workforce. All applications are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status (disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, active duty wartime or campaign badge veterans, Armed Forces service medal veterans), or based on any individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law.    Job Specifications  Relocation Offered?:   No   Work Schedule:   Days   Languages:   English - spoken   Current Licenses / Certifications:   None   Relevant Work Experience:   Financial Services-6+ yrs, Investment Management - 6+ yrs, Investment Management - 2-5 yrs, Financial Services-2-5 yrs   Position Located In:   CO - Lone Tree   Education:   BA/BS   Job Type:   Full Time    Category:Investment Management & Research  Activation Date: Thursday, May 10, 2018  Expiration Date: Thursday, June 14, 2018  Apply Here

Homewood Suites by Hilton Fayetteville is now hiring a Part Time Food and Beverage Host/Hostess. This position will mainly be Monday through Thursday 4:00 pm to 8:30 pm with occasional early weekend mornings when needed. A Food and Beverage Attendant with Homewood Suites by Hilton is responsible for cooking and replenishing food and service ware, inventory of kitchen supplies, clearing tables, and conversing with our guests for our complimentary breakfast/evening buffet. What will it be like to work for this Hilton Worldwide Brand? Homewood Suites by Hilton exists to provide the touches, familiarity and comforts of home so that extended stay travelers can feel at home on the road. Guests enjoy the extra space and privacy of the suites, the casual atmosphere and the many homelike amenities and services. In fact, Homewood Suites by Hilton is consistently ranked above the competition by guests, thanks to an appealing combination of bundled services, award-winning quality and the benefits of Hilton Honors. If you appreciate the feeling of home and know what to do to make others feel at home, you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Team Member with Homewood Suites by Hilton. What will I be doing? As a Food and Beverage Attendant, you would be responsible for cooking/restocking food and service ware and for clearing tables for our complimentary breakfast/evening social buffet in the hotel's continuing effort to deliver outstanding guest service and financial profitability. Specifically, you would be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards: Cook and restock food and service ware for breakfast buffets Clear tables during the complimentary breakfast/evening social period Ensure tableware is in good and working condition and report any defects for repair Retrieve and clean dirty dishware Clean kitchen and lodge area to standards Inventory of kitchen supplies (food, tableware, etc) Respond to guest inquiries and requests and resolve issues in a timely, friendly and efficient manner Any additional duties as assignedSince being founded in 1919, Hilton has been a leader in the hospitality industry. Today, Hilton remains a beacon of innovation, quality, and success. This continued leadership is the result of our Team Members staying true to our Vision, Mission, and Values. Specifically, we look for demonstration of these Values: Job Requirements-- >  What are we looking for? Hospitality - We're passionate about delivering exceptional guest experiences. Integrity - We do the right thing, all the time. Leadership - We're leaders in our industry and in our communities. Teamwork - We're team players in everything we do. Ownership - We're the owners of our actions and decisions. Now - We operate with a sense of urgency and discipline In addition, we look for the demonstration of the following key attributes: Quality Productivity Dependability Customer Focus Adaptability Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all! What will it be like to work for Hilton? Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all! Job Type: Part-time Experience: restaurant: 1 year Education: High school Required work authorization: United States

BioLegend develops world-class, cutting-edge antibodies and reagents for biomedical research, manufactured in our state-of-the-art facility in San Diego, CA. Our mission is to accelerate research and discovery by providing the highest quality products at an outstanding value, along with superior customer service and technical support. Our product expertise covers a diverse set of research areas including Immunology, Neuroscience, Cancer, Stem cells, and Cell Biology.    Job Summary    The Research Associate Product Development will be involved in product and reagent development for cell separation related applications. This position will have the opportunity to independently drive research projects from conception to completion, and will interact with multi-disciplinary teams.   Essential Functions    Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.   Primary cell preparation tasks   Development and optimization of assays aimed at cell isolation and cell analysis   Cell preparation, cell separation, and cell staining using conjugated antibodies to identify the isolated cell purity and yield   Identification and implementation of new assay technologies that have an impact on assay throughput and/or performance   Preparation of detailed Standard Operations Procedures (SOPs) that enable transfer of validated assays to project teams   Keeping all of the experimental records   General lab duties such as helping to keep the lab organized and clean, cleaning the incubators, and ensuring that buffers are available for use when needed   Other duties as assigned   Competencies   Accountability   Dependability   Quality of Work   Teamwork   Minimum Qualifications - Education and Experience   Bachelors or Masters Degree in a Life Sciences related area   2+ years of hands-on experience in an industry setting with handling cells such as cell preparation, immunofluorescent staining, cell culture, and cell separation   Experience with primary cell preparation, tissue culture, and cell separation   Preferred Qualifications  Education and Experience   Working experience with immunofluorescence microscopy or immunohistochemistry   Experience with flow cytometry   Work Environment & Physical Demands    While performing the duties of this job, the employee regularly works in a laboratory environment.    The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.    While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands and fingers to handle, feel, or operate objects, tools or controls, and reach with hands and arms. The employee is frequently required to stand, talk and hear.

Why is PowerChord looking for a top-notch Full Stack Software Engineer?  PowerChords SaaS platform helps manufacturers and franchises grow online engagement and in-store sales through their retail networks. Working with leading brands around the world, weve combined years of industry expertise with advanced technology to provide easy-to-use, scalable tools that help independent retailers and franchisees compete against large, online retailers.  PowerChord is expanding its Product and Engineering teams to launch a new Digital Marketing Platform. This SaaS platform is focused on automating every aspect of digital marketing for multi-location businesses so each location has personalized targeting, messaging and performance metrics.  Why is the  Full Stack Software  Engineer important at PowerChord?  As a Software Engineer, youll have ownership and responsibility over technical architecture, implementation, and maintenance of our platform and products.  Working at PowerChord wont be boring! You will have the opportunity to advocate for and learn new techniques and technologies in the pursuit of high quality, reliable systems. You will be asked to consistently improve the way we work as we strive to achieve optimal velocity and frequently ship software you are proud of and that reliably solves problems for our clients.  At PowerChord, you can be a part of something new, and big. You wont be asked to lead the maintenance of legacy systems. Were working exclusively on new problems and new products. You can make a significant impact at PowerChord while enjoying a flexible work schedule.  What are examples of work that the Full Stack Software Engineer does at PowerChord? Writes JavaScript, writes more JavaScript, and then enjoys writing even more JavaScript   Manages the complexity of building first class universal JavaScript applications   Works with Go, Docker, Kubernetes, and other new stack technologies   Participates in code and design reviews, teaching and learning from other engineers   Requirements  The following are some examples of profiles that are relevant to us: Full stack engineering experience, with strong cloud fundamentals   Hands on development experiencing scaling complex systems   Production experience with Node JS   Production experience working with an assortment of modern JavaScript tools and frameworks such as Webpack, React, Redux, ES6/ES7, Babel, etc.   Experience interacting with APIs (REST, GraphQL, etc.)   Exposure to architectural patterns of a large, high-scale SaaS application   Familiarity with DevOps concepts and techniques such as Continuous Integration and Deployment, virtual machines, containers, and cloud hosting services such as Google Cloud   Benefits  Working at PowerChord: We hire talented people so you wont be micromanaged   Competitive compensation including simple IRA with 3% company match   14 days of vacation your first year  woo hoo! + 2 additional days each year after that (22 max)   Health is important  we carry a variety of plans to meet your needs and budget   Unlimited coffee, cold beverages & snacks   Dress for success in your own personal style - shorts and flip flops will do   Company sponsored tech talks and happy hours   Much more...   For more information please visit our website. www.powerchord.com  PowerChord is an equal opportunity employer. Must be legally eligible to be employed in the United States without sponsorship/transfer. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Job Summary We are looking for a Data Analyst for a contract role at a global B2B high tech company. The Data Analyst will support marketing and sales teams by analyzing website, marketing and sales data and providing insights into the effectiveness of marketing activities, for both channel sales and direct sales. The goal is to assess the results of such activities and provide insights for improvements and illustrate the business value generated by Marketing. This is a 40 hour per week, 6 month contract (extensions/expansion possible). Ideally, work onsite 1-2 days per week in Sunnyvale, CA. This is a W-2 employee of Stage 4 Solutions, health benefits offered. Responsibilities and Duties On a weekly basis, understand and monitor key performance indicators from all geographies and develop analysis and reports that shows the impact of marketing activities to direct and channel sales Data to be included in the business analysis includes sales data, website data and marketing information Prepare charts, tables, graphs, diagrams and dashboards to assist in planning, execution and analysis of the marketing activities Data will be collected from salesforce.com, Eloqua and Omniture for Website data analysis Develop and maintain data mappings and translations for missing and incorrect data Required Experience, Skills and Qualifications 5+ years experience in advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and Tableau, performing data analysis and visualization, in a B2B global high tech company Experience working with global enterprise solutions companies sales and marketing processes and teams Experience with both website data analysis through Omniture, and business data analysis Experience with data Salesforce.com and marketing automation tools Disciplined, detail oriented and absolutely focused on the data and its quality Self-starter that can develop solutions independently and execute well under pressure Bachelors degree Job Type: Contract

BACKGROUND   Humane Society Silicon Valley (HSSV) is an independent, privately funded, 501(c)(3) non-profit organization serving people and pets for over 85 years. We offer quality adoptions, affordable spaying/neutering, vaccinations, microchipping services, pet care services, and education programs to enhance the human-animal bond. Established in 1929, we have adopted more than 500,000 animals into permanent, loving homes and are the worlds first model shelter.   We are passionate about and guided by our five core initiatives:   Preventing unwanted births   Treating and rehabilitating animals   Finding homes for animals   Helping people to keep their pets   Educating youth and community members   Through these initiatives, HSSV gives animals in our community more than a home, we give them a second change for a better life.   DESCRIPTION & RESPONSIBILITIES   Reporting to the Director of Marketing, you bring creativity and inspiration to your design concepts, and convey our mission and brand promise, creating compelling materials that resonate with target audiences, and are appropriate for each communication channel. You work as a member of the team to support and grow our brand, assuring a cohesive and evolving visual identity throughout all campaigns and projects. Your primary focus is on brand awareness, adoptions, development and medical services, but also contribute to campaigns with departments across the organization. You ensure all materials are in alignment with our brand guidelines and provide guidance to departments as needed. And as manager of our digital asset management system, youll collaborate with departments to define ongoing photography and video needs. You will identify and create photos, videos, illustrations, infographics and motion graphics that emphasize the human-animal bond, relationships between animals, and animal emotions and behavior in support of our mission and a range of campaigns.   You are an enthusiastic, flexible team player who is passionate about saving and enhancing livesboth two-legged and four-legged. A self-starter who enjoys working collaboratively and cross-functionally, and isn't frightened to try out new ways of doing things.   Apply understanding of the "bigger picture" in a creative way, keeping in mind the mission and strategic goals of the department and organization.   Implement HSSVs visual guidelines to maintain integrity of our branding.   A strong capability to select multimedia assets (e.g., imagery, video, illustrations) that accurately reflect and advance our mission and brand, and demonstrate awareness of the culture of the shelter/rescue culture and the diversity of our constituents, especially the relationship between people and animals, between animals, and animal emotions and behavior.   Develop concepts and final materials for campaigns and projects, including, but not limited to, social media and website assets, infographics, animated graphics, email, print collateral (brochures, flyers, posters, postcards, invitations, etc.), digital and print advertising, t-shirts, hats, signage, banners, etc.   Create branded resources (e.g., letterhead templates) for use by staff and train them on their usage.   Manage both the digital asset management (DAM) system and shared project deliverables shared files, including teaching staff how to use the DAM system, identifying needs, adding assets and managing DAM system volunteers.   Research, evaluate and work with external vendors to ensure the quality and intention for print materials, and digital as needed, while staying on budget and on time.   Provide departments with up-to-date production costs for budgeting and tracking expenditures on projects.   Stay abreast of the latest design trends and technology and experiment with how to integrate them into the organization's brand in partnership with team members.   Strong organizational and time management skills and the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities are essential, including use of project management tools.   Perform related duties as required.   Qualifications & Experience   Required Qualifications   Track record of creating strong, creative, lively and compelling work that is reflective of an organizations brand, audiences, subject matter and contributes to organizational goals.   Must be highly proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign and Illustrator).   Experience creating graphics for print and digital media (see list above).   Ability to work with, direct and prepare files for outside vendors (e.g., designers; printers; photographers) and prepare files for internal department use.   Project management experience: discuss and gather requirements; develop timelines; keep on track to meet deadlines; track work in project management tools (we use Asana).   Experience creating motion graphics, illustrations, infographics, videos and photography.   Comfort working both independently and collaboratively within a small, close-knit team, and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentpaying keen attention to detail and balancing competing, often tight, deadlines.   Excellent interpersonal communications skills, including active listening, open to critique of work and effective collaboration skills.   Can be in contact with animals for purposes of creating marketing assets (e.g., Facebook Live, capture assets, work with photographer/videographer).   Occasional evening or weekend work may be required for larger adoption or other organization-wide events.   Preferred Qualifications   Proficiency in Microsoft Office products such as Word, Power Point and Excel is helpful.   Experience capturing the human-animal bond and animals expression and body language in motion graphics, photos, illustrations and/or videos, will be given added consideration.   Experience coordinating field photography and videography sessions a plus.   Familiarity with designing for WordPress websites helpful.   An understanding of basic HTML and CSS helpful.   Nonprofit/shelter/rescue experienceas a volunteer or employee a plus.   Required Experience & Education   Three to five years relevant professional experience.   A bachelors degree in a relevant field.

Welcome! Delta is the most admired airline and we thank you for your interest in joining our team of Ready Reserve Customer Service Agents!   Delta is known for its legendary, reliable service to its customers, our number one focus is the safety of our passengers while enhancing every aspect of their travel experience. Our award winning employees effectively demonstrate our core values: Honesty, Integrity, Respect, Perseverance, and Service in every aspect of their work. As a member of our above wing crew, you will be central in demonstrating that commitment to our customers by making their travel experience as smooth and pleasant as possible. At Delta, our brand is critical to our continued success. As a Ready Reserve Customer Service Agent, you play a key part in keeping our brand strong by demonstrating strict adherence to uniform compliance, maintaining professionalism, and exhibiting a positive persona inside and outside of work. Additionally, excellent internal and external customer service is another attribute that keeps our Delta brand strong.  Working the front lines at the airport, you will play a vital role in demonstrating that commitment and reinforcing the Delta difference! Delta understands the demands of air travel and is determined to make the experience as smooth and enjoyable as possible for our customers. Delta employees practice and advocate safety-conscious behaviors during all work activities.  SUMMARY OF ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:  In this role, Ready Reserve Customer Service Agents serve our customers in both the ticketing and gate areas at airport locations.   Our professionals serving as a ticket agent are the first to greet our customers and guide and assist them with the ticketing and baggage check-in process.   The ticketing process requires the use of computers and agents are responsible for all aspects of the ticketing process - selling, printing, reissue. In addition, a ticket agent is also responsible for managing the check-in process - ensuring our customers have the proper documentation for travel, properly tagging baggage and performing lifting tasks that involve transferring baggage from scales to conveyor belts. Several other lifting tasks will involve handling items as low as floor level and as high as waist level. This job requires frequently lifting bags or items weighing up to 50 pounds. This job also requires occasionally lifting bags or items weighing between 50 and 70 pounds.   Our professionals serving as gate agents help our customers with routing, trip planning and gate boarding.   The gate agent position requires the use of computers and assists our customers with seat availability, gate announcements with regard to the boarding process, flight status, checking and handling baggage, managing and initiating the boarding process. Gate agents are also required to operate jet ways to place them in position prior to aircraft arrival and lifting, opening, closing, and securing aircraft doors.   All customer service agents are required to work consistently in public areas surrounded by other people and be able to understand and respond to a variety of questions about travel information. This position requires standing for long periods of time. Additionally, you may be responsible for escorting unaccompanied minors and disabled passengers throughout the airport.   As a Ready Reserve Customer Service Agent of Delta Air Lines, you will work between 150 and 1,400 hours per year.   Think you have what it takes to help us change how passengers feel about flying these days? If you are team-oriented, are willing to work diligently in a dynamic work environment, and positively adapt to changes and quickly find resolutions to problems by understanding our customers' needs and maintaining professionalism and composure, then we would love to welcome you to the Delta team, and let's not forget about our "uplifting" flight privileges! Many employees have used this entry level position for other opportunities at Delta.   Practices safety conscious behaviors in all operational processes and procedures.  To qualify for this position, you must:  Have a high school diploma or GED equivalent  Have a valid driver's license  Be at least 18 years of age  Pass an extensive post offer pre-employment background check, including finger printing and a criminal history record check required by federal law  Pass a post offer pre-employment drug test  Frequently lift bags or items weighing up to and including 50 pounds.  Occasionally lift bags or items weighing between 50 and 70 pounds.  Pass a physical agility test  Be authorized to work in the US  Possess entry-level computer skills  Strong verbal and written communication skills using appropriate grammar, tone, and pronunciation  Be willing to work a fixed and/or rotating schedule including afternoons, evenings, weekends and holidays

Job Description As an intern in the services team in the Bosch Center for Artificial Intelligence you will have a chance to work on interesting machine learning problems related to autonomous driving, driver assistance technologies, sensor data analysis, spatio temporal modeling and many more exciting topics. You will have access to state of the art infrastructure for computing and large industrial scale data sets and have the opportunity to improve upon products that impact millions of people worldwide.   Qualifications Required Qualification s:  Currently pursuing MS or PhD in a related technical field.  Strong foundations in machine learning.  Experience with working on large data sets in a distributed computing environment.  Proficient in programming in python / R or other numerical computing languages.  Good coding practices, ability to write efficient, readable and error free code.  Be enthusiastic and able to collaborate in a team environment.  Ability to translate technical concepts into simple to understand, communicable ideas.  Curious and passionate about learning everything.  Desired Qualifications:  Experience in Spark or Hadoop based big data ecosystem.  Strong interest or past experience with Spatio-temporal data sets.  Interest in visualization tools for large data sets.  Active github / publications to demonstrate past work.  Additional Information Duration: 12 weeks (summer internship)  Required Application Materials:  Resume/CV  By choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce - EOE/Protected Veteran/Disabled.  BOSCH is a proud supporter of STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics) Initiatives  FIRST ROBOTICS (For Inspiration and Recognition of Science and Technology)  AWIM (A World In Motion)

Overview   SolarWinds writes monitoring software for network, system, database, and other IT professionals to monitor the computer and network systems of our world. SolarWinds software gathers large amounts of time series numeric and textual log data that needs analysis to yield value to our customers. Data scientists and analysts provide a foundation for finding which algorithms and approaches to use in order to yield the most value for detecting patterns, anomalies, and problems within a set of data.   Responsibilities   + Work on problems relevant to business success by applying quantitative methods   + Use statistical concepts such as regression, time series analysis, mixed models, Bayesian methods, clustering, to analyze data and provide insights   + Work in a collaborative environment, partnering with other scientists and engineers to bring analytical rigor and statistical methods to the challenges of analytics in time series and log data.   Qualifications   + Knowledge of statistical methods and data analytics methods such as regression, clustering, and data modeling.   + Knowledge of machine learning such as decision trees, random forest, and neural networks.   + Ability to retrieve, organize and cleanse data using a querying technology.   + Ability to think mathematically, including probabilistic reasoning.   Desired Skills   + Familiarity with data science tools like Jupyter / Anaconda notebooks, AWS Sagemaker, or Azure Machine Learning Toolkit   + Fluency in Python, R, or SQL.   + Development skills in Python, Java, Go, or C#.   SolarWinds is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. SolarWinds will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.   Job ID _2018-10919_   \# Positions _1_   Category _Other_   Position Type _Intern (Full Time)_   Business Group _SolarWinds Cloud_

Mechanical Engineer - Automation and Tooling - CEP001239  About Us  At Cepheid, we are passionate about improving healthcare through faster, more accurate diagnostic tests. With our GeneXpert® System, weve taken the most sophisticated molecular technology and packaged it into an automated, easy-to-use format that has quickly become the platform of choice worldwide. From the largest laboratories to small physician offices, our game-changing solution delivers critical answers when clinicians and patients need them most. Through strong molecular biology capabilities and ongoing product innovation, we are focused on developing tests for healthcare-associated infections, sexual health, critical infectious disease, virology, and oncology applications. Come join our vision for a  better way  and help make life better for us all! For more details, visit us at www.cepheid.com or follow us on Twitter (@CepheidNews).  Description  Job Description  Automation Engineer, Mechanical  CEP6169  Job Summary  The Automation Engineer, Mechanical, is responsible for the design, development, documentation and production launch of complex, high speed assembly equipment. This equipment will be used in the assembly of high volume disposable diagnostics. The successful candidate will be responsible for system specification, machine tooling and fixture design. Hands on and supervisory experience of automated equipment assembly, electro-mechanical equipment and mechanical design of prototype fixtures is required. Position also requires interacting with contract manufacturers for outsourced projects.  Responsibilities:  Responsible for the design and development of automation projects including, initial concept, design requirements, system architecture, test plan, prototype fabrication /testing and final production release.  Create detailed documentation including but not limited to design input requirements, specifications, design of experiments, acceptance test and validation protocols, detailed drawings and bills of materials.  Selection and specification of machine components such as motors, pneumatics, conveyors and part feeding components.  Modify existing equipment to improve product quality, increase part throughput, decrease cost, and/ or strengthen safety measures.  Author test protocols, reports & manufacturing documents related to new processes  Creation of documentation ECO's, DCO's  Manage outside suppliers and contract manufacturers  Evaluate and recommend engineering changes to equipment or processes that will ensure maximum productivity  Maintain strict compliance with ISO13485, cGMP, QSR and other applicable Quality Management System standards  Qualifications  Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities  Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field; or, equivalent combination of education and experience to perform at this level  A minimum of 3-5 years of mechanical design experience including but not limited to high speed assembly tools, precision mechanism, tooling and fixture design, Robotics and automation  Hands on experience with electro-mechanical troubleshooting of automated manufacturing environment  Conceptual understanding of plastic injection molding process  Experience in ISO13485 and Quality regulations environment  Excellent oral and written communication skills  Proven project management skills  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills combined with a strong technical presence  Proficient in SolidWorks 2015 or later, PDM or EPDM preferred  Familiar with ANSI Y14.5-2009 and proficient in the use of GD&T as it applies to machined parts  10% travel  Additional Data  Preferred Qualifications   Knowledge of PLC and machine controls is a plus.  Danaher Corporation Overview  Danaher is a global science & technology innovator committed to helping our customers solve complex challenges and improve quality of life worldwide. Our world class brands are leaders in some of the most demanding and attractive industries, including life sciences, medical diagnostics, dental, environmental and applied solutions. Our globally diverse team of 62,000 associates is united by a common culture and operating system, the Danaher Business System, which serves as our competitive advantage. We generated $16.9B in revenue last year. We are ranked #133 on the Fortune 500 and our stock has outperformed the S&P 500 by more than 1,300% over 20 years.  At Danaher, you can build a career in a way no other company can duplicate. Our brands allow us to offer dynamic careers across multiple industries. Were innovative, fast-paced, results-oriented, and we win. We need talented people to keep winning. Here youll learn how DBS is used to shape strategy, focus execution, align our people, and create value for customers and shareholders. Come join our winning team.  Organization  : Cepheid  Job Function  : Engineering  Primary Location  : North America-North America-United States-CA-Sunnyvale  Schedule  : Full-time

Invite a friend Back to job search Job Description   D.A. Davidson & Co., a leading investment banking firm with operations throughout the U.S., is accepting applications for the Investment Banking Internship Program in its Baltimore, Chicago, Denver, Orange County, Portland, and Seattle locations. The Investment Banking Internship Program will be a 10 week program that will introduce potential candidates to our Investment Banking business and the firm. Interns are expected to work on strategic assignments assisting deal teams with mergers and acquisitions, public offerings, private placements and other advisory services. Interns are expected to commit such time as is necessary to effectively fulfill their responsibilities, which will require 40 hours per week. A portion of our permanent Analyst positions will be filled from our summer internship program.   Experience and Skills   Qualifications   Major in business or business related field preferred (science and math majors included) with a minimum 3.5 GPA   Strong computer proficiency (Microsoft Office skills, specifically Excel and PowerPoint)   General level of financial knowledge   Quantitative and analytical skills   Excellent quantitative, analytical and verbal/written communication skills   Good judgment in confidential situations and ability to exercise discretion when handling confidential information   Strong work ethic and teamwork skills   Duties   Research and provide presentation / research material for pitch books, memorandums, presentations and other projects   Work on various projects to support client relations   Support business development activities of senior investment bankers   Monitor and update contact/deal database as needed for specific deal teams   Assist deal teams with other necessary day to day responsibilities

Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end.  YouTube has become the expressive platform of a generation empowered to shape what matters in culture and society today. Together we are building a truly global destination for creativity, learning and free expression. You will have the opportunity to help shape the next generation of YouTube.  In joining the YouTube Trust and Safety marketing team, your work will help make the internet safer, protect openness and free speech and strengthen our brand and reputation. In this role youll work with teams across Trust & Safety operations, Product, PR and Policy to shape our products, policies, education and partnerships to establish YouTube as a trusted leader in handling harmful content proactively and transparently.  Youll define the learning plan and use deep insights to represent the voice of users and creators in product plans. Youll be on the cutting edge of todays evolving digital culture and policy environment and will work to collaboratively define strategies to empower YouTubes users with tools and education to be better internet citizens.  Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.  Responsibilities  Lead product marketing (define value proposition, goals, narratives, Go-to-Market strategy, partnerships) for key Trust & Safety launches across products including YouTube Kids and News  Keep on the cutting edge of an evolving cultural, policy and product environment. Contribute strategically to thought leadership narrative for the industry around child safety and news  Use YouTubes platform reach, creators and voice to empower users with tools and education to be better internet citizens  Use data and insights voraciously to understand and align the business on areas of focus and to identify needs for product/policy improvements and education across the YouTube main app and YouTube Kids  Qualifications  Minimum qualifications:  Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.  8 years of experience in product marketing with core responsibilities creating and executing successful consumer and brand marketing campaigns.  Preferred qualifications:  Experience developing strategy and business plans.  Passion for consumers and consumer experiences, with a demonstrated ability to utilize consumer research and data to drive actionable insights to inform marketing strategy and improve the consumer experience.  Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously in a fast paced dynamic environment.  Ability to influence effectively cross-functionally.  A passionate leader and communicator and able to build collaborative partnerships with product and other cross-functional teams.

Trimble  is recruiting for an  Electronics Technician  to fill an opportunity in  Norcross, GA.   Job Description  :   Beena Vision  A Trimble Entity is the leading manufacturer of vision-based automatic wayside inspection systems for the railroad industry. Beena Vision has pioneered and developed a number of innovative products using sophisticated machine vision and non-contact measurement technologies.   Responsibilities:  The Technician in this position will be responsible for:   Setting up test platforms for software and hardware tests such as cameras and image acquisition hardware (including Genlcam cameras)   Perform long running tests of various hardware and software configurations   Modify server hardware PCI cards and connectors   Use remote log in tools to test and diagnose issues   Given minimal training, learn new procedures, perfect them, and document them   Communicate with software development team effectively   Must have familiarity with general lab equipment such as function generators, power supply   Qualifications  :   AS degree in Engineering, IT, or equivalent experience   1 - 3 years experience in hardware and software testing; experience with camera systems highly desired   Ability to learn new 1st and 3rd party software   Ability to follow written procedures   Ability to create documentation for learned software and procedures   Ability to work standing up for most of the day   Knowledge in electronic debugging   Knowledge of Windows Server OS   Knowledge of Motherboards and PCI cards   Knowledge of TCP/IP Networking, (NAT, DNS, DHCP, Static IP)   Effective communication skills (written and verbal)   Work well under pressure and adapt to changing priorities and schedules   Work independently and/or collaboratively as part of a team   Show attention to detail and accuracy   Trimble is transforming the way the world works by delivering products and services that connect the physical and digital worlds. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics enable customers to improve productivity, quality, safety and sustainability. From purpose built products to enterprise lifecycle solutions, Trimble software, hardware and services are transforming a broad range of industries such as agriculture, construction, geospatial and transportation and logistics.   Trimble is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor. EOE/M/F/V/D     #LI-POST

Cambridge Associates is a leading global investment firm. We work with non-profit institutions, pension plans, and private clients to build investment portfolios that help them meet their philanthropic goals, pensioners obligations, or personal endeavors. Our goal is to meet clients wherever they are in the investment process. We offer a variety of services to complement those needs, from acting as an outsourced investment office to providing access to our world- class digital research platform. Committed to independence since our founding more than 40 years ago, we are motivated only by what is best for our clients.    CA has a global team of outstanding investment advisors and an extensive research platform to support them. With more than 1,200 employees in eleven locations around the globe, we are constantly looking to discover new ideas for our clients portfolios. This extensive network helps us to identify and access the best global investment opportunities all over the world.    CA's Investment Analyst program:    Investment Analysts (IAs) work on intact teams in collaboration with Investment Directors to provide investment and capital markets research, analysis, and advice to clients across four practice areas: Endowments & Foundations, Pensions, Private, and CA Capital.    Each IA is generally responsible for 8 to 12 clients and handles several projects at once, and there is a strong tradition of teamwork and cooperation among members of the Investment Analyst team to help manage the workload. The role is focused on quantitative analysis and includes a strong qualitative component as IAs work to describe market conditions and relay investment recommendations to clients in written reports.    In addition to client work, Investment Analysts often choose to join auxiliary teams, which provide support for the broader firm and allow individuals to develop skills outside of traditional client work.    Investment Analysts participate in a two-year program with strong performers receiving promotions to continue to the Associate and Senior Associate level. From here, team members interested in continuing their career at Cambridge Associates are encouraged to apply for the Associate Investment Director role. Common career paths also include client offices, additional industry opportunities, and MBA/masters programs.    We Offer:   Comprehensive training program and continuing education opportunities   Structured mentorship program, which pairs Investment Analysts with tenured Investment Directors   Access and ability to attend meetings with clients and top-tier investment managers   Auxiliary teams including: Alternative Assets (PE/VC), Professional Development, Training, Recruiting, and Excel   Team leadership roles to gain management experience   Support and sponsorship for professional designations such as CFA, CAIA, etc.   Responsibilities Include:   Analyzing investment managers portfolios   Responding to clients questions and requests   Gathering and analyzing historical asset allocation, spending, and performance data   Evaluating financial histories   Preparing exhibits and other presentation documentation   Requirements:   Bachelors degree (ALL majors) with a record of high academic achievement   Strong quantitative, analytical, and communication skills   Interest in investments and the capital markets or related quantitative fields   Demonstrated ability to work independently and as part of a team   Must be eligible to work in the US without sponsorship or restriction   Applications must include a tailored  cover letter  and a copy of  unofficial transcripts  for consideration .

Position Overview: This position is responsible for providing services to girls that include career planning, work life guidance, daily living support, housing and money management education, health and self-care assistance, pro-social relationship development, intensive daily case management, familial and crisis counseling and leads psycho-educational life skills groups by performing the following duties:  Role and Responsibilities Engagement of girls to complete comprehensive individualized youth assessment. Complete screening for significant risk factors, mental health issue, substance abuse/use, and trauma histories.  Work with each girl to create an individualized service plan and identify personal long and short term goals in the areas of education, career, health and wellness, housing, money management, and social relationships.  Provide support, education and counseling to assist girls with positive progress and attainment of individualized goal plan.  Provide case management, connecting activities, and identify and utilize natural supports where appropriate.  Ensure each girl receives guidance to reduce barriers to success and linkages to community supports.  Assist girls with becoming aware of resources within their community where they can access services related to food, housing transportation, job training, education, employment, legal medical, and mental health needs.  Support girls with life skills knowledge, development and practice. Assist girls with educational support and career counseling. Identifying interests, strengths, areas for development, and realistic placement opportunities. Expose girls to various educational and career paths.  Engage girls in employability skills development and job linkages. Assist girls with preparation for job searches and interviews and development of good work habits. Educate and support girls on understanding their physical health and maintenance needs. Assist girls with accessing resources to support their physical health and maintenance needs, emphasizing importance on preventive health care and pregnancy prevention. Assist girls over 18 with obtaining and maintaining housing, while helping them understand lease and rental agreements, budgeting and paying bills, effectively communicating with landlords and roommates, engaging in successful conflict resolution, and learning routine household maintenance. Provide informal counseling activities specifically aimed at preparing girls for independence and refer girls in need of more intensive services to therapy as needed.  Provides counseling and peer mediation in crisis situations. Leads group counseling sessions to enhance social development of girls. Assist with coordination of and attends all community service, enrichment activities, and family building events. Acts as lead person for these activities as required. Works in partnership with girls and their families to find a common approach to problem solving, crisis counseling and intervention. Ensures girls are transported and cared for in a safe environment (including escorting to bus stop), if needed, based on the individual Center needs.  Ensures outcome measures compliance in the girls reported progress. Ensures the integration of the Six Developmental Domains and Gender Responsive programming in daily practices. Work in collaboration as a part of a multi-disciplinary team. Role models for staff appropriate strategies decided upon to effect change in the behavior of girls.  Provides training and skill building materials to staff to increase the gender competence of staff in their role and interaction with girls.  Prepares for and participates in care review meetings and may facilitate care review meetings. Uses ETO to document in an accurate and timely manner in accordance with PACE policies and regulatory agency standards.  Assist program in any other required tasks as needed.   Qualifications and Education Requirements  Required Bachelor Degree from four-year College or University. Major in Social Work, Psychology, Mental Health, and Counseling or a related field or equivalent experience preferred. Minimum three to five years prior experience working with adolescent youth. Knowledge of case management practices, youth counseling skills and crisis management skills. Experience using personal computers and basic office equipment. Current Florida drivers license valid to transport youth.  Other Requirements Must adhere to Agency Values and Principles. Upholds the ethical standards of the Agency and professional disciplines Code of Ethics. Follows policies and procedures of the Agency Must work evenings and weekends as required to fulfill workload requirements. Must be able to travel by automobile, plane, train, etc.; occasional overnight travel may be required.  Preferred Masters in in Social Work, Psychology, Mental Health, Counseling or a related field. Knowledge of state and school districts policies; knowledge of laws relating to children and families  Experience working with at-risk youth

The Global Client Group resides within Global Commercial Services. This position is for one of our most strategic, bluebox partners. Overall responsibilities include the retention and expansion of a portfolio of Global Commercial Card accounts in the Global Client Group. Qualified candidate must provide proactive consultation to enhance customer relationships and to drive program growth, profitability, client satisfaction and ongoing retention.    Job Description   Create strategic vision, action plans and set goals in a manner that will encourage opportunities for global expansion and cross selling   Ownership of global strategic business plan that incorporate strategies and actions for penetrating relationships across business units and service units including metrics of success and regular, formal reviews   Maintaining detailed understanding of the customers business, their organizational goals and objectives   Accountability in developing broad and deep relationships at all levels organizationally and globally- both internally and externally   Understand and communicate the American Express premium value we deliver on a customer by customer basis with formal quantification of that unique value   Work with key contacts across Amex to cross-sell complimentary products and services including those designed for Commercial Card customers such as Meeting Card, Platinum Card and B2B solutions, as well as other Amex products   Consult with client and interface with key linkages and operations to ensure that service quality and contractual obligations are met/exceeded   Resolve issues using formal project and or action plans when required   Proactively provide expertise on policies, bench-marking, and recommendations to optimize programs, reduce costs and drive efficiencies for clients  Qualifications  Seeking a minimum of 5 years prior strategic relationship management and/or sales experience. Ideal skill set includes the following:   Entrepreneurial approach to portfolio management; able to identify opportunities and manage through a sales process   Innovative and collaborative approach to solving problems and overcome barriers impacting client value or growth   Demonstrate effective oral and written presentation and communication skills, with the ability to influence internal and external partners   Proven relationship management skills demonstrating a comfort level and effectiveness in seeking out and establishing relationships at C levels and within cross-functional areas within Fortune 500 companies   Ability to effectively present products, technical solutions, and financials to clients in a strategic manner   Must be able to travel to visit clients   Ability to effectively influence and manage change and display strong leadership and global & cultural business knowledge   Display an understanding of elemental finance, corporate expense management and treasury concepts which drive the value proposition of our Global Corporate Card products   Bachelors/MBA degree preferred, but will highly consider business experience   Live within the New York tri-state area Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.  ReqID: 18006260  Schedule (Full-Time/Part-Time): Full-time

Amazon is looking for a motivated individual with strong analytical skills and technology experience to join our Inbound Cross Dock team (IXD).  In this position, the successful candidate will be responsible for identifying opportunities and implementing initiatives to improve inventory placement and fulfillment to our customers. As a member of the IXD team, they will play an integral part in Amazon.com's inventory management by successfully partnering with various operations, transportation, IT, retail, and finance teams to support new business initiatives. The candidate should enjoy diving into data then recommending and executing solutions to enhance the supply chain. Position provides opportunities to influence one of the high visibility/high impact areas in the organization.  The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, an ability to work in a fast-paced, high-energy and ever-changing environment. The drive and capability to shape the business group strategy is a must.  This role will influence the direction of the business by leveraging our data to deliver insights that drive decisions and actions. The role will involve translating broad business problems into specific analytics projects, conducting deep quantitative analyses, and communicating results effectively. We see a high potential for influence and growth in this role as we transform our data into actionable insights to continue to fuel the growth of this business. The role will help the organization identify, evaluate, and evangelize new techniques and tools to continue to improve our ability to deliver value to Amazons customers.  The complexity of research and skills for this role is well beyond basic data entry and research. It involves complex analysis and diving deep into key metrics based on requests, building and maintaining multiple databases, knowledge of software applications to create tools, and understanding of multiple programming languages.  The following provides some detail of the job duties and responsibilities. Use analytical and statistical rigor to solve complex problems and drive business decisions.  Manipulate/mine data from database tables (ex. Redshift, MySQL, Oracle) using SQL.  Manipulate/mine data from log files by writing scripts (ex. PERL, Python, UNIX)  Develop analytical tools: deep-dive tools, UIs, metrics, and dashboards  Perform deep-dives and root cause analysis to answer business questions Basic Qualifications  BS in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Applied Economics or in another quantitative field OR 2+ years of Amazon experience  6+ years of hands-on experience in data mining and/or quantitative analysis  both descriptive and inferential/predictive analysis.  Fluent knowledge of relational databases (SQL).  Experience with analytics tools such as R or Python  Experience working with very large, disparate data sets  Ability to distill problems and constraints from informal business requirements and to be comfortable dealing with ambiguity and competing objectives  Proven capability to identify opportunities to combine disparate data sources to uncover new business insight  Ability to distill problems and constraints from informal business requirements and to craft an analytic approach to solving the issue  Ability to distill and communicate complex analysis and insights in oral presentation and written form Preferred Qualifications  MS/PhD in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Applied Economics or in another highly quantitative field  3+ years of hands-on experience in predictive modeling and analysis  Experience with BI analytics/ reporting/visualization tools (preferably Tableau)  Familiarity with supply chain management concepts - forecasting, planning, optimization, and logistics - gained through work experience or graduate level education.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills. The role requires effective communication with senior management as well as with colleagues from operations and business backgrounds.  Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer  Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation
